info.title: OTData API
info.description:
The software-independent standard interface for the transmission of telematics data.

This is not a documentation of an existing API, it is the specification how to write a correct API according to the OTData API standard. You may only implement parts of it.

The authentication is specified by the interface operator.

It is recommended to use OAuth 2.0.

tags.name: Tour Management
tags.description: Retrieve and manage tours and their belonging drives and tasks

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: All specified webhooks listed until upgrade to OAS3.1

post.description: May be used to send live data to server.

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

get.summary: Returns a list of the latest live data
get.description:
Filter search: ``customer_uri``, ``object_uri``, ``vehicle_group_id`` and ``tour_uri``

Modify response: ``fields``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Specifies if just a selection of fields should be returned

Filter search: ``customer_uri``, ``object_uri``, ``vehicle_group_id``, ``tour_uri`` and ``drive_uri``

Time selection: ``from``and ``to``

Modify response: ``fields``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Specifies if just a selection of fields should be returned

post.description: May be used to send calculated ETA to server.

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

get.description:
Filter search: ``tour_uri`` and ``drive_uri``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

Filter search: ``tour_uri`` and ``drive_uri``

Time selection: ``from``and ``to``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

get.summary: Returns a list of tacho files
get.description:
Filter search: ``customer_uri``, ``object_uri`` and ``vehicle_group_id``

Time selection: ``from``, ``to`` and ``used_time``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

parameters.name: used_time
parameters.description: Indicates to which time tags `from` and `to` refer: ``activity`` refers to the time the activities were stored in the tacho files, ``download`` refers to the download time of the tacho file ``data`` refers to the time stemp of the tacho files

post.description: May be used to send tacho files to server.

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

get.description:
Filter search: ``sender``

Time selection: ``from``and ``to``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

post.summary: Creates a message for a message channel

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

put.description: If the request is used to create a new resource, the ``If_Match`` header SHOULD be omitted. If it is used to update an existing resource, the ``If-Match`` header MUST be send.

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

get.summary: Returns a list of tours, optionally with embedded subresources
get.description:
Due to the potentially frequent need, this request allows embedding of subresources in the response. These are marked with a leading underscore and MUST NOT be cached, because no concurrency control is possible due to the missing ``ETag`` header.

Filter search: ``customer_uri`` and ``object_uri``

Time selection: ``from``and ``to``

Modify response: ``embed``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

schema.description: Depending on the value of ``embed``, subresources will be embedded

post.summary: Creates a tour and optionally its subresources
post.description:
Due to the potentially frequent need, this request allows embedding of subresources and shipments linked to the tour in the request and therefore also in the response. These are marked with a leading underscore and MUST NOT be cached, because no concurrency control is possible due to the missing ``ETag`` header.

If subresources are embedded in the response, the ``ETag`` header SHOULD not be sent. The ``ETag`` header is only related to the tour resource, not to its subresources. A response with subresources and ``ETag`` header could be misleading.

Modified request body: ``create_subresources``

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

schema.description: Depending on the value of ``create_subresources``, subresources will be embedded

get.summary: Returns a tour, optionally with embedded subresources
get.description:
Due to the potentially frequent need, this request allows embedding of subresources in the response. These are marked with a leading underscore.

If subresources are embedded in the response, the ``ETag`` header SHOULD not be sent. The ``ETag`` header is only related to the tour resource, not to its subresources. A response with subresources and ``ETag`` header could be misleading.

 Modify response: ``embed``

schema.description: Depending on the value of ``embed``, subresources will be embedded

put.description:
Due to the potentially frequent need, this request allows embedding of subresources and shipments. These are marked with a leading underscore. The request MAY be used to create a resource and its subresources but MUST NOT be used to update any subresources. 

If the request is used to create a new resource, the ``If_Match`` header SHOULD be omitted. If it is used to update an existing resource, the ``If-Match`` header MUST be send.

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

put.description: If the request is used to create a new resource, the ``If_Match`` header SHOULD be omitted. If it is used to update an existing resource, the ``If-Match`` header MUST be send.

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

ot_id.description: Registered OpenTelematics ID of the responder

api_version.description: Version of the OpenTelematics API used, e.g.:`"2.0.0"`

api_version.name: API-Version
api_version.description: Version of the OpenTelematics API used, e.g.:`"2.0.0"`

from.name: from
from.description: Only data from this point on are returned

to.name: to
to.description: Only data up to this point in time are returned

ot_id.name: OT-ID
ot_id.description: Registered OpenTelematics ID of the requester

cursor.name: cursor
cursor.description: Cursor for cursor-based pagination. Use ``next_cursor`` from response body to get the next page.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The limit parameter sets a maximum number of results to return per call.

embed_required.name: embed
embed_required.description: Whether to embed subresources and shipments linked with the tour in the response.

if_none_match.name: If-None-Match
if_none_match.description: Newest known entity tag of the resource as defined by [RFC7232](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7232#section-3.2)

if_match.name: If-Match
if_match.description: Newest known entity tag of the resource as defined by [RFC7232](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7232#section-3.1)

if_match_required.name: If-Match
if_match_required.description: Newest known entity tag of the resource as defined by [RFC7232](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7232#section-3.1)

create_subresources.name: create_subresources
create_subresources.description: Whether also subresources and shipments linked to the tour should be created.

no_content.description: No Content. The server has successfully fulfilled the request and there is no additional content to return in the response payload body

not_modified.description: Not Modified. The resource has not been modified since the version specified by the request header If-None-Match.

bad_request.description: Bad Request. The server cannot or will not process the request, due to a client error.

unauthorized.description: Unauthorized. The request requires user authentication.

forbidden.description:
Forbidden. The server understood the request, but refuses to authorize
it.

not_found.description:
Not Found. The server has not found anything matching the effective
request URI.

precondition_failed.description: Precondition Failed. One or more conditions (e.g. If-None-Match header) given in the request header fields evaluated to false when tested on the server.

unsupported_media_type.description: Unsupported Media Type. The origin server is refusing to service the request because the payload is in a format not supported by this method on the target resource.

precondition_required.description: Precondition Required. The origin server requires the request to be conditional.

internal_server_error.description:
Internal Server Error. The server encountered an unexpected condition
which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

service_unavailable.description: Service Unavailable. The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay.

schema.description: Depending on the value of ``create_subresources``, subresources will be embedded in the body
Depending on the value of ``create_subresources``, subresources will be embedded in the body

type.description: A URI reference that uniquely identifies the problem type only in the context of the provided API. Opposed to the specification in RFC-7807, it is neither recommended to be dereferencable and point to a human-readable documentation nor globally unique for the problem type.

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers, usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem that is helpful to locate the problem and give advice on how to proceed. Written in English and readable for engineers, usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem, e.g. by adding a fragment identifier or sub-path to the problem type. May be used to locate the root of this problem in the source code.

allOf.description: An object contains information about e.g. a vehicle or/and a device which can be linked to e.g. live data sets. The data structure is very broad to allow use in very different contexts.

io.description: Generic list for IO data, e.g. sensors.

name.description: Unique name of the data set.

value.description: The value in one of the specified types.

characteristic.description:
`satellite`: GPS, Galileo, GLONASS etc.
`indirect`: Bluetooth, Wi-Fi etc.

satellite_count.description: Number of satellites to estimate accuracy

address_type.description:
Type to distinguish between different types of addresses, so that
you can have several addresses in one list

addition.description: Further address information or additional details

is_mandatory.description: Indicates if it is mandatory to notify

allOf.description: Estimated time window from the given ``eta`` and confidence level

confidence_level.description: Confidence level for the given ``time_window`` in percent

drive_number.description: Indicates the position of the drive in a tour

adr_totals.description:
Summarized information about the dangerous goods that are present
during the drive. May be different for each drive.

allOf.description: URL to which webhooks should send requests
JSON Web Token for authentication at callback server
URI structure is depending on the ``topic``

expiration_time.description: Expiration time to limit the lifetime and avoid obsolete subscriptions

topic.description: Distinguishes between different topics that can be subscribed to

tour_event_types.description:
``transmitted``: tour transmitted to e.g. driver, device or vehicle, 
``read``: tour read by driver, 
``excepted``: tour excepted by driver, 
``denied``: tour denied by driver, 
``started``: tour started, 
``canceled``: tour canceled, 
``deleted``: tour deleted, 
``finished``: tour finished

drive_event_types.description:
``started``: drive started, 
``paused``: drive paused, 
``interrupted``: drive interrupted due to an unplanned event e.g. accident, 
``canceled``: drive canceled, 
``deleted``: drive deleted, 
``arrived``: arrived at destination, 
``finished``: drive and including tasks finished

status.description:
Information about the status of an item e.g. the condition at
delivery

linked_tasks.description: List of URIs of tasks to which the shipment is linked. The URIs of the corresponding tour and drive are simply the subsets of the task_uri.

allOf.description: Reference (e.g. number or name of the shipment used in shipment tracking), that is used independently of API-specific IDs and URIs.

addresses.description: All addresses relevant for the shipment

items.description: List of all single items of the shipment

allOf.description:
Item ID of the package the item is part of (e.g. the ID of the
palette to which the item belongs). With the `parentid` you are able
to map any tree structure in the item list.

codes.description: List of codes on the item, e.g. barcodes

type.description: Type to distinguish between different types of codes

scan_required.description: Indicates if the item must be scanned

adr_info.description:
Information on classification according to the 'Agreement concerning
the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road' (ADR). Summarized information on the dangerous goods present on each drive can be found in ``adr_totals`` in the drive resource

key_value_list.description: List of generic key-value pairs for custom extension of the standard

company_card.description: The company card which was used

data.description: container data bytes encoded in Base64

axel.description: axle number front to back beginning with 0

allOf.description: All data of the Bus FMS-Standard
All data of the Truck FMS-Standard
All data of the Truck FMS Standard and the Bus FMS-Standard

fms.description: As specified in FMS-Standard description Version 04. The data is transmitted in interpreted form. `Offsets` and `per bit gain` are already calculated. Data that is sent in different repetitions on the CAN bus can be transmitted as one.

supporting.description: Whether the Truck FMS Standard, the Bus FMS Standard or both are supported. The according schema is used.

fms_truck_bus.description: All data common in the Truck and Bus FMS Standards

engine_total_fuel_used.description:
SPN 250.
Accumulated amount of fuel used during vehicle operation in liters.

fuel_level_1.description:
SPN 96.
Ratio of volume of fuel to the total volume of fuel storage container in percent.

fuel_level_2.description:
SPN 38.
Ratio of volume of fuel to the total volume of fuel storage container in percent.

actual_engine_percent_torque.description:
SPN 513.
The calculated output torque of the engine in percent. The data is transmitted in indicated torque as a percent of reference engine torque.

engine_speed.description:
SPN 190.
Actual engine speed which is calculated over a minimum crankshaft angle of 720 degrees divided by the number of cylinders in rounds per minute.

engine_total_hours_of_operation.description:
SPN 247.
Accumulated time of operation of engine in hours.

vehicle_identification_number.description:
SPN 237.
Vehicle Identification Number as assigned by the vehicle manufacturer.

sw_version_supported.description:
SPN 2806.
Information that identifies which issue level of the FMS-standard document the software included in the FMS gateway supports. Four bytes, representing ab.cd type revision level identification.

diagnostics_supported.description:
SPN 2804.
Status signal which indicates if the FMS Vehicle Interface (FMS Gateway) supports the handling of diagnostic messages from the vehicle network onto the FMS network.

requests_supported.description:
SPN 2805.
Status signal which indicates if the FMS Vehicle Interface (FMS Gateway) will respond to requests from the FMS device for the PGNs listed in the FMS Interface Specification.

high_resolution_total_vehicle_distance.description:
SPN 917.
Accumulated distance travelled by the vehicle during its operation in meters.

vehicle_motion.description:
SPN 1611.
Indicates whether motion of the vehicle is detected or not.

driver_2_working_state.description:
SPN 1613.
State of work of the driver 2.

driver_1_working_state.description:
SPN 1612.
State of work of the driver 1.

vehicle_overspeed.description:
SPN 1614.
Indicates whether the vehicle is exceeding the legal speed limit set in the tachograph.

driver_1_time_rel_states.description:
SPN 1617.
Indicates if the driver 1 approaches or exceeds working time limits (or other limits).
0=normal
1=15 min. bef. 4 1/2h
2=4 1/2h reached
3=15 min bef. 9h
4=9h reached
5=15min bef. 16h
6=16h reached

driver_2_time_rel_states.description:
SPN 1618.
Indicates if the driver 2 approaches or exceeds working time limits (or other limits).
0=normal
1=15 min. bef. 4 1/2h
2=4 1/2h reached
3=15 min bef. 9h
4=9h reached
5=15min bef. 16h
6=16h reached

driver_1_card.description:
SPN 1615.
Indicates the presence of driver card 1.

driver_2_card.description:
SPN 1616.
Indicates the presence of driver card 2.

direction_indicator.description:
SPN 1619.
Indicates the direction of the vehicle.

tachograph_performance.description:
SPN 1620.
Indicates the tachograph performance; including electronic or mechanical analysis, instrument analysis, speed sensor analysis, mass storage analysis, and printer analysis.

handling_information.description:
SPN 1621.
Indicates that handling information is present.

system_event.description:
SPN 1622.
Indicates that a tachograph event has occurred.

tachograph_vehicle_speed.description:
SPN 1624.
Speed of the vehicle registered by the tachograph in kilometers per hour.

engine_coolant_temperature.description:
SPN 110.
Temperature of liquid found in engine cooling system in degrees Celsius.

ambient_air_temperature.description:
SPN 171.
Temperature of air surrounding vehicle in degrees Celsius.

fuel_rate.description:
SPN 183.
Amount of fuel consumed by engine per unit of time in liters per hour.

instantaneous_fuel_economy.description:
SPN 184.
Current fuel economy at current vehicle velocity in kilometers per liter.

service_brake_air_pressure_circuit_1.description:
SPN 1087.
The pneumatic pressure in the service brake circuit or reservoir 1 in kilopascal.

service_brake_air_pressure_circuit_2.description:
SPN 1088.
The pneumatic pressure in the service brake circuit or reservoir 2 in kilopascal.

high_resolution_engine_total_fuel_used.description:
SPN 5054.
Accumulated amount of fuel used during vehicle operation in liters. High resolution used for calculations and fleet management systems.

aftertreatment_1_diesel_exhaust_fluid_ta.description:
SPN 1761.
Ratio of volume of diesel exhaust fluid to the total volume of diesel exhaust fluid storage container in percent.

fms_telltale_status.description: The array enables the transmission of the five Telltale blocks, each of which is sent in a different repetition on the CAN bus.

telltale_block_id.description: ID of the block the taletell status 1-15 in this item belongs to.

brake_pedal_position.description:
SPN 521.
Ratio of brake pedal position to maximum pedal position in percent.

fuel_type.description:
SPN 5837.
Type of fuel currently being utilized by the vehicle. See table in FMS Standard description.

total_fuel_used_gaseous.description:
SPN 1040.
Total fuel consumed (trip drive fuel + trip PTO governor moving fuel + trip PTO governor non-moving fuel + trip idle fuel) over the life of the engine in kilograms.

retarder_torque_mode.description:
SPN 900.
State signal which indicates which retarder torque mode is currently generating, limiting, or controlling the torque. See Appendix D in SAE documentation.

actual_retarder_percent_torque.description:
SPN 520.
Actual braking torque of the retarder as a percent of retarder configuration reference torque SPN 556.

retarder_selection_non_engine.description:
SPN 1716.
Position of the driver's selector for retarders that are not part of the engine system, expressed as percent and determined by the ratio of current position to the maximum possible position.

fms_truck_bus_mutual.description: Data specified in the `truck only` and `bus only` sections but actually occur in both of them.

wheel_based_speed.description:
SPN 84.
Speed of the vehicle as calculated from wheel or tailshaft speed in kilometers per hour.

clutch_switch.description:
SPN 598.
Switch signal which indicates that the clutch pedal is being pressed.

brake_switch.description:
SPN 597.
Switch signal which indicates that the driver operated brake foot pedal is being pressed.

cruise_control_active.description:
SPN 595.
Whether cruise control is switched on.

parking_brake_switch.description:
SPN 70.
Switch signal which indicates when the parking brake is set.

accelerator_pedal_position.description:
SPN 91.
The ratio of actual position of the analogue engine speed/torque request input device (such as an accelerator pedal or throttle lever) to the maximum position of the input device in percent.

fms_truck_only.description: Data specified in the `truck only` section that does not appear in the `bus only` section.

pto_state.description:
SPN 976.
This parameter is used to indicate the current state or mode of operation by the power takeoff (PTO) device.

engine_percent_load_at_current_speed.description:
SPN 92.
The ratio of actual engine percent torque (indicated) to maximum indicated torque available at the current engine speed, clipped to zero torque during engine braking.

vehicle_weight.description: The array enables the transmission of up to 225 (15*15) axle weights, each of which is sent in a different repetition on the CAN bus.

axle_location.description:
SPN 928.
To identify to which of several similar devices (such as tires or fuel tanks) the information applies. The 4 bits represent a position number, counting front to back on the vehicle.

tire_location.description:
SPN 928.
To identify to which of several similar devices (such as tires or fuel tanks) the information applies. The 4 bits represent a position number, counting left to right when facing in the direction of normal vehicle travel (forward).

axle_weight.description:
SPN 582.
Total mass imposed by the tires on the road surface at the specified axle.

service_distance.description:
SPN 914.
The distance which can be travelled by the vehicle before the next service inspection is required in kilometers. A negative distance is transmitted if the service inspection has been passed.

at_least_one_pto_engaged.description:
SPN 3948.
Indicates that at least one PTO is engaged.

gross_combination_vehicle_weight.description:
SPN 1760.
The total weight of the truck and all attached trailers in kilograms.

allOf.description: Data specified in the `bus only` section that does not appear in the `truck only` section.

status_2_of_doors.description:
SPN 3411.
Composite indication of all bus door statuses.

ramp_wheel_chairlift.description:
SPN 1820.
Signal which indicates the actual position of the ramp / wheel chair lift.

position_of_doors.description:
SPN 1821.
Signal which indicates the actual position of the doors.

seconds.description:
SPN 959.
Part of a parameter used to represent time.

minutes.description:
SPN 960.
Part of a parameter used to represent time.

hours.description:
SPN 961.
Part of a parameter used to represent time.

month.description:
SPN 963.
Part of a parameter used to represent a calendar date.

day.description:
SPN 962.
Part of a parameter used to represent a calendar date.

year.description:
SPN 964.
Part of a parameter used to represent a calendar date.

selected_gear.description:
SPN 524.
The gear that the transmission will attempt to achieve during the current shift if a shift is in progress, or the next shift if one is pending. `-125`=neutral, `125`=park

current_gear.description:
SPN 524.
The gear currently engaged in the transmission or the last gear engaged while the transmission is in the process of shifting to the new or selected gear. Transitions toward a destination gear will not be indicated. Once the selected gear has been engaged then Current Gear will reflect that gear. `-125`=neutral, `125`=park

bellow_pressure_front_axle_left.description:
SPN 1725.
Used for bellow pressure information. In kilopascal.

bellow_pressure_front_axle_right.description:
SPN 1725.
Used for bellow pressure information. In kilopascal.

bellow_pressure_rear_axle_left.description:
SPN 1725.
Used for bellow pressure information. In kilopascal.

bellow_pressure_rear_axle_right.description:
SPN 1725.
Used for bellow pressure information. In kilopascal.

hybrid_battery_pack_remaining_charge.description:
SPN 5464.
Indicates the hybrid battery pack remaining charge in percent.

steering_wheel_angle.description:
SPN 1807.
The main operator`s steering wheel angle (on the steering column, not the actual wheel angle) in radian.

allOf.description: Creation time of the data set
